comments:
It is same problem as bug: 24867 (concerning similar problem in M1) which state is 'worksforme' but it seems that it does not. I have no idea how to start the workbench

I am using Ubuntu and JDK 5.0. 
Eclipse generates in .log the following message: 

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-12-06 18:30:28.814
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: /home/kk/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/33/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so: /home/kk/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/33/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory
        at java.lang.ClassLoader$NativeLibrary.load(Native Method)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary0(ClassLoader.java:1751)
        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadLibrary(ClassLoader.java:1660)
        at java.lang.Runtime.loadLibrary0(Runtime.java:822)
        at java.lang.System.loadLibrary(System.java:992)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Library.loadLibrary(Library.java:123)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.gtk.OS.<clinit>(OS.java:19)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Converter.wcsToMbcs(Converter.java:63)
        at org.eclipse.swt.internal.Converter.wcsToMbcs(Converter.java:54)
        at org.eclipse.swt.widgets.Display.<clinit>(Display.java:122)

        at org.eclipse.core.internal.runtime.PlatformActivator$1.run(PlatformActivator.java:226)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:376)
        at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)

It was installed from a fresh dowload.

The SWT library is not finding all of its dependencies.  Are you on
x86-64?  If so, it may be that you're using a 32-bit VM but have
64-bit GTK+ installed, or the other way around.

If it's not an architecture mismatch, you can run:

  ldd /home/kk/.eclipse/org.eclipse.platform_3.1.1/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi/bundles/33/1/.cp/libswt-pi-gtk-3139.so

to see which dependency you are missing.

I have downloaded the latest 3.2 version and it works fine.
Nothing changed in the environment. I have no idea why the 3.1.1 does not.
Yes I am runnig a 64bit platform but VM is also 64bit and so the eclipse workbench.
Thanks.
